title: Ryan Reynolds teases secret Marvel meeting as Deadpool could join MCU
text:
Deadpool may be coming to the MCU (Picture: Twitter/Twentieth Century Fox)

Deadpool may be coming to the Marvel Cinematic Universe despite the character’s repeated jokes, after Ryan Reynolds teased a secret meeting with Marvel.

The actor, 42, shared a photo of himself at the Marvel Studios on Monday, captioning the picture: ‘Auditioned for the role of “Anthony Stark”. Didn’t come even remotely close, but the nice man with the taser escorted me to the ground.’

While he may not be able to take the role of Iron Man away from Robert Downey Jr., it looks likely that Deadpool may cross over into the Marvel Cinematic Universe pretty soon.

Following Disney’s acquisition of Fox, which previously distributed the Deadpool movies, it’s likely the antihero will become a Disney/Marvel character, though plans have yet to be confirmed.

Aside from joking about auditioning to be Iron Man, Ryan remained tight-lipped on whether he was at the Marvel Studios for a meeting about Deadpool or another possible project.

Ryan had fans speculating after revealing he was at the Marvel Studios for a meeting (Picture: Twitter)

Deadpool director Paul Wernick told Entertainment Weekly: ‘We’re always in touch with Ryan. We’ve got several projects with him in addition to the Deadpool universe.

‘I think the party line and truth is we’re all still figuring it out. Marvel has promised to continue to let us play in the R-rated Deadpool universe, and the hope is that they will also let us veer into the MCU a little bit as well and play in that sandbox.’

He added: ‘Our feeling and Ryan’s feeling is that it’s got to be the right idea, it’s got to be great… I think once we collectively agree what idea that great idea is we’ll be off to the races.

‘Ryan’s super-busy, we’ve got a lot of projects lined up, but we wake up thinking about Deadpool, and we go to sleep thinking about Deadpool.’
